subject: Re: [junit] [TEST] JTest v4.5 and what is says about JUnit
msgSnippet: Hi, I work with parasoft tech support and the answer to the question below is yes.  One can use an @pre tag in javadoc to find such problems. Carson ... even
messageBody:
Hi, I work with parasoft tech support and the answer to the question
below is yes. One can use an @pre tag in javadoc to find such
problems.

Carson

--- In junit@y..., Ilja Preu√ü <ilja.preuss@w...> wrote:
> > The problem is that I don't know if there was a problem with
> > the input, the processing or something random. If your code
> > returns an IllegalArgumentException, then I have a much
> > better idea of the issues.
>
> If you are on the same team, you could ask him. Possibly you could
even
> find out by simply looking at the code and/or the JUnit tests.
>
> One point I find more critical is that invalid input should be
> fail-fast. If a method fails because you provided invalid input to a
> prior method call, such problems are really hard to find. Can JTest
help
> with such issues?
>
> Regards, Ilja
